title: SM UB-21
text:
SM "UB-21" was a German <a href="German%20Type%20UB%20II%20submarine">Type UB II</a> <a href="submarine">submarine</a> or <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> in the <a href="German%20Imperial%20Navy">German Imperial Navy</a> () during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>. The U-boat was ordered on 30 April 1915 and <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launch</a>ed on 26 September 1915. She was <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commission</a>ed into the German Imperial Navy on 20 February 1916 as SM "UB-21". The submarine sank 33 ships in 26 patrols for a total of . Surrendered to Britain in accordance with the requirements of the <a href="Armistice%20with%20Germany">Armistice with Germany</a>, "UB-21" was sunk as a target by HMS <a href="HMS%20Terror%20%28I03%29">"Terror"</a> in the <a href="Solent">Solent</a> on 30 September 1920; the wreck was sold in 1970 and most had been cleared by 1998, although some remnants survive.
Design.
A <a href="German%20Type%20UB%20II%20submarine">German Type UB II submarine</a>, "UB-21" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a total length of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two <a href="K%C3%B6rting%20Hannover">Körting</a> six-cylinder, four-stroke <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>s producing a total of , two <a href="Siemens-Schuckert">Siemens-Schuckert</a> <a href="Motor-generator">electric motor</a>s producing , and one <a href="propeller%20shaft">propeller shaft</a>. She was capable of operating at depths of up to .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a maximum submerged speed of . When submerged, she could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "UB-21" was fitted with two <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s, four torpedoes, and one <a href="5%20cm%20SK%20L/40%20gun">SK L/40</a> <a href="deck%20gun">deck gun</a>. She had a <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> of twenty-one crew members and two officers and a 45-second dive time.
